ext_description.p: A Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship is the association between one interface terminal and a corresponding join terminal of the that specifies that the two terminals are shorted internally to the as part of its required functionality. This relationship is an explicit statement of the inherent functionality of a connector. Therefore no separate or is required to specify the nominal functionality of a connector. A may be supplied to support mapping the functional design to the connector join terminals.
ext_description.note: One use for this relationship is to specify the short between the terminal that is installed to the printed circuit assembly and the terminal that provides the access to the outside environment when an occurrence of is installed in the assembly.
Installation into the next higher assembly is not necessary to achieve this relationship.
There is a member of this relationship populated for every pair of terminals in the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the interface_terminal specifies the role of the for the Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship.
the join_terminal specifies the role of the for the Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship.
the connector specifies the that has the that are defined to be shorted by the Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship.
The combination of the connector and the join_terminal shall be unique within a population of Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship.
The combination of the connector and the interface_terminal shall be unique within a population of Packaged_connector_terminal_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Packaged_connector is a type of whose functionality between certain terminals is defined to be a short by this part of ISO 10303. The short shall be between the interface terminal and the join terminal specified by a member of . The short is a logical abstraction for CAD purposes. The detailed functional properties of the connector are defined in the connector specification.
ext_description.note: One use for a Packaged_connector is to provide access to the physical network of the printed circuit assembly from an external source.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a Packaged_connector and its usage in a design context as a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the characterized_connector_terminal_relationship is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_connector is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Packaged_connector as its . There shall be one or more for a Packaged_connector.

A Packaged_part_interface_terminal is a type of that is a terminal of a . An occurrence of the Packaged_part_interface_terminal provides access to the functionality of the assembly into which an occurrence of a is installed.

ext_description.p: the external_connector_function is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_part_interface_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Packaged_part_interface_terminal as its . There may be zero or more for a Packaged_part_interface_terminal.
ext_description.note: One interface terminal may be connected to several join terminals by members of .
